newsitem.title: ITALY: ALPINE SKIING-TOMBA OUT OF ACTION FOR UP TO 20 DAYS.
newsitem.headline: ALPINE SKIING-TOMBA OUT OF ACTION FOR UP TO 20 DAYS.

text.p: Italian Olympic and world Alpine skiing champion Alberto Tomba has been ordered to rest for up to 20 days after injuring himself while training on a glacier.
Tomba fell heavily, injuring his left knee and right wrist, at a training session in northern Italy on Tuesday and had to go to hospital for checks.
"Tomba will have to rest for 15-20 days before taking up competitive activity," the Italian winter sports' federation said on Wednesday.
The triple Olympic champion, who trains apart from other Italian skiers, had already ruled out the season-opening race on the glacier in Solden, Austria, at the weekend.
